Dear Ms. Crawford:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 17, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP)
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved; this includes identifying
behaviorally specific action steps.
o Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Individuals directly responsible for implementing the corrective action step for each
licensing statute and rule citation, e.g. workers, supervisors, program managers,
director, etc.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be implemented
and completed.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved; this
includes identifying specific action steps for continuous monitoring.
 Signature of the responsible party and date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions, initial treatment plan.
(2) The initial treatment plan developed by the social worker
shall document input from the resident, the resident’s parents,
direct care staff, and the referral source, unless documented as
inappropriate.
One of one active youth files reviewed did not have documentation that the plan was
developed with input from the youth’s parents and referral source.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Two of two employee files reviewed did not have documentation that the
Tuberculosis screening was completed prior to employment.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Two of two employee files reviewed did not have documentation that the employees
had completed any training hours at the time of this review.
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(i) Documentation that the grievance policy was provided as
required in R 400.4132.
4

One of two active youth files reviewed did not have documentation that the
grievance policy was provided to the youth’s parent. The agency has a grievance
policy, but the parents had not signed acknowledgement.
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions, initial treatment plan.
(4) The social service worker shall sign and date the initial
treatment plan.
One of one active youth files reviewed had the initial treatment plan present and
signed by the Social Worker but not dated as required.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions, updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
updated treatment plan for each resident at least once every 90-
calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
One of one active youth files reviewed did not have documentation that the updated
treatment plan was completed.
2.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 All signed documents should also include dates of signature.
 Treatment plan goals should also include dates covering the period of
treatment.
 Complete the Chief Administrator Assessment annually.
 Include all information in regard to contacts the youth have and this should
include dates, persons contacted, type of contact, and place of contact.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
5

maltreatment during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The requirements of the CA assessment were discussed, and the facility understands
the process. Because the original study was just completed six months ago, and the
requirement is for an annual assessment the assessment had not been completed.
The facility has had no incidents and the Chief Administrator had nothing to report for
the assessment.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with the staff present (License Designee) and the one
youth who was verbal. The youth interviewed was able to respond with single word
“yes”. He indicated feeling safe and liking his placement at the facility. He appeared
well kept and healthy. His room was viewed, and it was in very good condition. The
second youth’s room was observed, and it also was well kept. Both rooms had all of
the required items present. The second youth had just entered the program on
12/1/2021. The staff reported the are receiving referrals and it appears the referrals
are for youth within the autism spectrum. Staff also reported providing the necessary
care for the needs of the youth in the program.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
